page.title: 01Longtown's location/history.
page.content: Longtown is a large village in the north of Cumbria.It is on the River Esk,which flows into the Solway Estuary approximately one mile away.Longtown is 8.25 miles from Carlisle,the county town of Cumbria.It is three miles from the Scottish Border.To the east of Longtown are the beginnings of the Pennines and to the north the Southern Uplands.To the south-west of Longtown are the Lake District Hills & Mountains.The A7 passes through Longtown linking Carlisle with Edinburgh.Longtown is latitude 55'N,Longitude 3'W.It has a central position in the British Isles. Longtown's population today is some 2400.Evidence of settlement on the banks of the Esk dates from Stone & Bronge Age times.The 18th C. saw the beginning of the present day Longtown,when the Esk Bridge was built
